results.question: What is the capital of Australia?
results.single_model_answer: The capital of Australia is Canberra.

consensus_answers.openai/gpt-4o: The capital of Australia is Canberra.
consensus_answers.anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5:
The capital of Australia is **Canberra**.

Canberra is located in the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) in southeastern Australia, between Sydney and Melbourne. It was purpose-built as the capital and officially became the seat of government in 1927.
George Orwell wrote '1984'. The novel was published in 1949.
consensus_answers.google/gemini-3-flash-preview: **George Orwell** wrote *1984*. It was published in 1949.

results.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
results.single_model_answer: The largest ocean on Earth is the Pacific Ocean.

consensus_answers.openai/gpt-4o: The largest ocean on Earth is the Pacific Ocean. It covers more than 63 million square miles and is larger than all of Earth's land areas combined.
consensus_answers.anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth. It covers approximately 165 million square kilometers (about 63 million square miles), which is roughly 46% of the world's ocean surface and about one-third of the total Earth's surface.
consensus_answers.google/gemini-3-flash-preview:
The largest ocean on Earth is the **Pacific Ocean**.

It covers about 63 million square miles (163 million square kilometers), which is more than one-third of the Earth’s surface. It is so large that it is greater than the total land area of all the world’s continents combined.
